result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin A Parks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin A Parks appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Kevin A Parks.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state. Case is in contest posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 1, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Due to Court being down 10/7/2022, parties agreed via email to reschedule the 10/7/2022 pretrial conference to 11/1/2022 at 2:00 p.m. by zoom.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KD and BMW.

Defendant in court. Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date. The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Kevin A Parks not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/13/22 @ 2p
